intro: Alangium ebenaceum var. tutela, commonly known as the Tutela sandalwood, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
